insights: The BMW iX3 is the first product of the Noia class platform, a completely new electrical architecture that represents the future of BMW.
The iX3 features an 800-volt system, 800 kilometers of range, and Linder NMC cells, making it one of the most efficient electric cars BMW has made.
The car has a four-wheel drive system with rear-wheel drive bias and produces 269 horsepower.
The iX3's design is more proportionate and less radical than previous BMWs, with a focus on simplicity and solidity.
The car features a panoramic vision display that projects information onto the windscreen, reducing the need for multiple screens and buttons.
The iX3 will be followed by other models based on the Noia class platform, including the i3, which is an electric version of the 3 series.
BMW plans to roll out the panoramic vision display across its range, including faceless models, and has confirmed that 14 new BMWs will feature this display.
